title: Did King Louis XVI really ever have any plan to support the French Revolution or was he just waiting for the opportune moment to seize power again? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your making it sound like king Louis XVI was an stupid/selfish/evil/crazy man who only cared about his crown. He wasn’t. He was at least somewhat familiar with people like Voltaire, Jean-Jacques Rousseau, David Hume, Edward Gibbon, etc. He was willing to work with the national assembly. The Jacobins betrayed him and Marie Antoinette even after they caved into their demands, not the other way around.
He was a king whos power had been totally diminished to say the least… he had no plans to support The FRENCH Revolution whom he regarded as peasants…
